Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517 243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/1/24 Youth A was in a verbal argument with another youth
and Staff 2 warned that they could restrain Youth A and eventually
Staff 2 did. Staff 2 pushed Youth A over onto the couch and
continued to bump into Youth A.
Investigation This complaint was received on 03/11/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I interviewed the Complainant via telephone on 03/11/2024. No
additional information was provided.
I spoke with Foster Care Worker via telephone on 03/11/2024.
Foster Care Worker reported she was informed of the incidents
involving Youth A and staff. She expressed no concerns regarding
the agency.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the agency on
03/11/2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Consumer
Rights Officer reported there were two incidents on 03/01/2024,
the first incident involves Youth A with Staff 1, and second incident
involves Youth A and Staff 2. Consumer Rights Officer provided
incident reports for both incidents and video footage for the
incident involving Staff 2. Consumer Rights Officer reported Staff
1 and Staff 2 will not be working on the wing with Youth A pending
the investigation.
2

I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 03/11/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A was placed at the
agency on 01/25/2024. Youth A does not want to be at the agency
and wants to go live with her grandmother. She reported last week
Staff 2 bumped and pushed her onto the couch. Youth A denied
assaulting staff or doing anything to provoke staff. Youth A does
not like Staff 2 working on her wing. Youth A denied being injured
or having any marks/bruises from being pushed by Staff 2. Youth
A said she has not been actively participating in the program
because she wants to go and live with her grandmother. She has
only completed 9% of the program and is required to complete
100% before she can be discharged. She admitted the reason she
is not making progress in the program is because she yells and
cusses often and does not participate in activities.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the agency on 03/13/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a Team Leader and has been
working at the agency for 19 years. Staff 2 reported on 03/01/2024
he came on the wing to assist because Youth A was being
aggressive with Youth B. He said Youth B was removed from the
wing. Youth A was throwing things, pushing, and threatening him.
He blocked Youth A from picking up the mop bucket and throwing
a chair. Staff 2 said he was trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A,
but she continued to be verbally and physically aggressive with
him. He said Youth A grabbed his eyeglasses and he pushed her
hand away. Youth A tried to push him, so he put his hands on her
shoulder, pushed her away from him, and that’s when Youth A fell
into a seated position on the sofa. He said Youth A again got up
and tried to assault him and he pushed her back to sit on the sofa.
Staff 2 admitted that he pushed Youth A away from him, but it was
only done because she kept moving closer to him and he did not
use a lot of force. Staff 2 denied being verbally or physical
aggressive with Youth A. He further denied using profanity or
saying anything about Youth A’s appearance.
A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist on
04/05//2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 03/01/2024 was reviewed on 03/11/2024
(Note: video has no audio). Youth A is seen at the exit door of the
wing and Staff 2 is standing in the middle of the wing. Youth A
walks over to the bathroom door and attempts to grab the mop
bucket Staff 2 walks over and blocks the area. Youth A walks over
to the employee desk area, attempts to grab a chair, Staff 2 grabs
the chair before it hits the floor. Youth A walks over to Staff 4 and
3

Staff 2 puts his arm across blocking Youth A from getting to Staff
4. Youth A appears to be yelling, Staff 2 moves backwards, and
Youth A moves closer to Staff 2, and points her finger at his face.
Staff 2 pushes Youth A’s hand away from his face and pushes
Youth A away from him. Youth A picks up an object and throws it
at Staff 2, hitting him in the face. Staff 2 is still standing facing
Youth A, Youth A pushes Staff 2, Staff 2 grabs Youth A by the
shoulder pushes her backwards, and she falls into a seated
position on the sofa. Youth A gets up and appears to be yelling
and coming at Staff 2. Staff 2 again pushes Youth A back on the
sofa. Staff 2 moves away and stands by the employee desk and
Youth A walks to the exit door.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 03/01/2024 written by Staff 2. Youth
A was trying to fight another youth, so that youth was
removed from the wing. Youth A attempted to throw a mop
bucket, so Staff 2 blocked the area. Youth A attempted to
knock over a chair, Staff 2 continued to use verbal de-
escalation to redirect Youth A. Youth A charged at Staff 2
attempting to hit him in the chest several times, Staff 2
used his arms to block Youth A’s punches. Youth A
continued to hit and threaten staff by telling him she would
have her father shoot Staff 2. Youth A threw a water bottle,
a fidget toy, and a brush at Staff 2.
• Personnel file for Staff 2: no disciplinary action.
• Agency Policy: Staff and Client Interaction Guidelines for
staff and client interaction: All staff should conduct
themselves in a professional and appropriate manner
when interacting with the clients in our care. Employees
are expected to establish good working relationships to
foster mutual trust with clients.
➢ Corporal punishment (spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, pulling hair, etc.) of clients
is never, under any circumstances, permitted.
➢
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage reviewed, and
documentation, a violation is established regarding Staff 2 pushing
Youth A, which is an inappropriate and prohibited form of
discipline.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation
Staff 1 uses derogatory language when speaking to Youth A and
speaks about Youth A’s appearance. Youth A does not feel safe
at the facility.
Investigation This complaint was received on 03/11/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I interviewed the Complainant via telephone on 03/11/2024. No
additional information was provided.
I spoke with Foster Care Worker via telephone on 03/11/2024.
Foster Care Worker reported she was informed of the incidents
involving Youth A and staff. She expressed no concerns regarding
the agency.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the agency on
03/11/2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Consumer
Rights Officer confirmed there was an incident on 03/01/2024, the
involving Youth A with Staff 1 and Staff 1 admitted that she was
frustrated due to Youth A’s behavior and Staff 1 told Youth A
“Shut the fuck up”. Consumer Rights Officer reported Staff 1 was
disciplined as a result of her using profanity.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 03/11/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported last week
Staff 1 told her to “shut the fuck up”. Youth A said she was
playing her radio and singing out loud, Staff 1 asked her to turn
5

the volume down, so she did and that’s when Staff 1 told her to
‘shut the fuck up”. Youth a denied Staff 1 said anything about her
appearance.
I interviewed Youth B at the agency on 03/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the
agency for 3 months and is placed on the same wing with Youth
A. Youth B recalled the day in question and reported Youth A was
being rude and aggressive with her and staff. She was removed
from the wing because Youth A was being aggressive. Youth B
did not witness Staff 1 cuss at Youth A. Youth B reported Staff 3 is
rude, because Staff 3 called her “retarded.” Youth B could not
recall the date or time when Staff 3 said that to her but said Youth
C was on the wing when this happened. Youth B did not report the
incident.
I interviewed Youth C at the agency on 03/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C recalls hearing
Youth B and Staff 3 arguing but does not remember hearing staff
3 call Youth B retarded. Youth C reported she has heard Staff 3
use the word “retarded.”
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 03/13/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a team leader and has been
working at the agency for 8 years. Staff 1 admitted on 03/01/2024
she was having a rough day with Youth A purposely trying to
annoy and irritate the staff. Youth A was cursing, yelling, and
antagonizing staff and other youths. She admitted she told Youth
A to ‘shut the fuck up”, but she denied saying anything negatively
about Youth A or any other youths’ appearance. Staff 1 said she
reported the incident immediately and was written up for using
profanity. Staff 1 explained a close friend recently passed away
and she was struggling on the day in question. She admits she
made a mistake and feels horrible about using profanity with
Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the agency on 03/13/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 is a Youth Coach and has been
working at the agency for 6 years. Staff 3 recalled an incident
involving Youth B getting upset, because Staff 3 closed the door
of the quiet room. Staff 3 said Youth B was in the quiet room and
had left room, so Staff 3 closed the door to the quiet room. Youth
B got mad, started, arguing, and got verbally aggressive with Staff
3. Staff 3 said it is the agency policy that when no one Is in the
quiet room the door needs to be locked. Staff 3 could not recall if
she used the word retarded with Youth B.
6

A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist on
04/05//2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 03/01/2024 written by Staff 1. Youth
A was displaying disrespectful and negative behavior from
5:30 pm to 6:50pm. Staff 1 utilized verbal intervention by
redirected Youth A. Youth A became irritable and
continued to be disrespectful. Staff 1 disengaged and
ignored Youth A’s comments. Youth A continued being
disrespectful, calling Staff 1 inappropriate name, playing
her music loud, Staff 1 became frustrated with Youth A
and told her to “shut the fuck up.” Staff 1 admitted to using
inappropriate language and knowing this type of language
is not acceptable.
• Personnel file Staff 3: no disciplinary action.
• Personnel file for Staff 1: violations for attendance and
punctuality policy.
• Agency Policy: Staff and Client Interaction Guidelines for
staff and client interaction: All staff should conduct
themselves in a professional and appropriate manner
when interacting with the clients in our care. Employees
are expected to establish good working relationships to
foster mutual trust with clients.
➢ Undignified language, cursing, and swearing are
viewed as verbal abuse and are prohibited.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation, a violation is
established regarding Staff 1 using derogatory language when
speaking to Youth A and Staff 3 calling Youth B “retarded.”
Conclusion Violation Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
